SUBRECIPIENT:THE RECIPIENT INTENDS TO USE A SUBAWARD TO IMPLEMENT THE ANACOSTIA GREEN BOAT PROGRAM WHICH SUPPORTS COMMUNITY SCIENCE, STEWARDSHIP, AND ENVIRONMENTAL EDUCATION GOALS. THE PROGRAM WILL OFFER PUBLIC, FREE ACCESS TO SIX DOUBLE KAYAKS LAUNCHED FROM HERITAGE ISLAND IN THE ANACOSTIA RIVER.  PARTICIPANTS WILL  TAKE PART IN A COMMUNITY SCIENCE PROGRAM FOCUSED ON COLLECTING MARINE DEBRIS FROM THE ANACOSTIA RIVER. 

THE RECIPIENT ALSO INTENDS TO USE A SUBAWARD TO RUN THE DC WATERSHED LID RETROFIT PROGRAM WHICH WAS DESIGNED TO IMPLEMENT LID AND OTHER INNOVATIVE URBAN NPS BEST MANAGEMENT PRACTICES (BMPS), AS WELL AS TARGETED STORMWATER RETROFITS FOR THE PURPOSE OF MEETING WATER QUALITY STANDARDS IN DISTRICT WATERBODIES.

LASTLY, THE RECIPIENT WILL USE A SUBAWARD TO SUPPORT TWO U.S. GEOLOGICAL SURVEY GAUGE STATIONS AT WATTS BRANCH AND ROCK CREEK THROUGH A MEMORANDUM OF UNDERSTANDING WITH THE U.S. GEOLOGICAL SURVEY (USGS).

DESCRIPTION:THIS AGREEMENT PROVIDES SUPPORT TO THE STATE OF OREGON TO IMPLEMENT ITS NONPOINT SOURCE MANAGEMENT PROGRAM, FOCUSING ON WATERSHEDS WITH WATER QUALITY IMPAIRMENTS CAUSED BY POLLUTED RUNOFF FROM NONPOINT SOURCES.  NONPOINT SOURCE IMPLEMENTATION PROJECTS INCLUDE A VARIETY OF STRUCTURAL AND NON-STRUCTURAL BEST MANAGEMENT PRACTICES (BMPS), WATERSHED PLANNING, MONITORING, TECHNOLOGY DEMONSTRATIONS, AND A VARIETY OF EDUCATION/OUTREACH PROGRAMS.ACTIVITIES:THE PROPOSED WORK IN THIS AGREEMENT INCLUDES SIX PROJECTS THAT WILL IMPLEMENTS RIPARIAN AND WETLAND BEST MANAGEMENT PRACTICES, MONITORING AND MAPPING, OUTREACH AND EDUCATION.   SUBRECIPIENT:THE ACTIVITIES UNDER THE SIX SUBAWARDS INCLUDE MONITORING AND INCENTIVES TO IMPROVE STREAM FLOW FROM IRRIGATION DITCHES, RIPARIAN PLANTING TO IMPROVE STREAM TEMPERATURE, PROPAGATION AND DISTRIBUTION OF NATIVE PLANTS FOR WATERSHED RESTORATION, PLANTING RIPARIAN BUFFERS, WETLAND RESTORATION, AND REGIONAL STORMWATER MAPPING.  OUTCOMES:
THE ANTICIPATED DELIVERABLES AND EXPECTED OUTCOMES INCLUDE NUTRIENT REDUCTION AND SEDIMENT REDUCTION, STREAM FLOW IMPROVEMENTS, TEMPERATURE REDUCTION, COORDINATION WITH PARTNER AGENCIES, OUTREACH AND EDUCATION.   DIRECT BENEFICIARIES OF THIS PROGRAM INCLUDE ALL STATE RESIDENTS AND OCCUPANTS, BOTH PERMANENT AND TEMPORARY.

NONPOINT SOURCE PROGRAM GRANTS ARE AWARDED UNDER SECTION 319(H) OF THE CLEAN WATER ACT FOR THE PURPOSE OF ASSISTING THE STATE OF OREGON AND TRIBES IN IMPLEMENTING THEIR APPROVED NONPOINT SOURCE MANAGEMENT PROGRAMS.  PROJECTS EMPHASIZE WATERSHED-BASED PLANNING AND PROJECT IMPLEMENTATION TO SOLVE HIGH PRIORITY NONPOINT SOURCE WATER QUALITY PROBLEMS.  PROJECTS FUNDED WITH THIS GRANT WILL SUPPORT: WATER QUALITY MONITORING OF 14 SAMPLING POINTS TO DETERMINE THE REDUCED EROSION IMPACT OF PIPING IRRIGATION WATER; OUTREACH AND EDUCATION TO LOCAL LAND OWNERS AS PROSPECTIVE RESTORATION PARTNERS;  RIPARIAN RESTORATION THROUGH INVASIVE WEED CONTROL AND PLANTING OF OVER 53,000 NATIVE TREES AND BRUSH; PARTIAL REMOVAL OF 850' OF AN ESTABLISHED LEVEE TO ALLOW FOR NATURAL WATER FLOW; STREAM CORRIDOR RESTORATION USING 90 LARGE WOOD PLACEMENT STRUCTURES; AND THE PROPAGATION OF 50,000 PLANTS TO SUPPORT RIPARIAN RESTORATION OF 200 ACRES AND 15 RIPARIAN MILES. DESCRIPTION:THIS AGREEMENT PROVIDES SUPPORT TO THE STATE OF IDAHO TO IMPLEMENT ITS NONPOINT SOURCE MANAGEMENT PROGRAM, FOCUSING ON WATERSHEDS WITH WATER QUALITY IMPAIRMENTS CAUSED BY POLLUTED RUNOFF FROM NONPOINT SOURCES.  NONPOINT SOURCE IMPLEMENTATION PROJECTS INCLUDE A VARIETY OF STRUCTURAL AND NON-STRUCTURAL BEST MANAGEMENT PRACTICES (BMPS), WATERSHED PLANNING, MONITORING, TECHNOLOGY DEMONSTRATIONS, AND A VARIETY OF EDUCATION/OUTREACH PROGRAMS.ACTIVITIES:THIS GRANT IS USED FOR THE IMPLEMENTATION OF IDAHO'S NONPOINT SOURCES MANAGEMENT PROGRAM AS DESCRIBED IN THEIR 2020-2025 NONPOINT SOURCE PLAN. IDAHO SUPPORTS AN EXTENSIVE SUBAWARD PROGRAM WHICH FUNDS PROJECTS ACROSS THE STATE TO ADDRESS NONPOINT SOURCE ISSUES. WITH THIS GRANT, THEY ARE FUNDING UP TO NINE PROJECTS THAT WILL IMPLEMENT HABITAT AND FARMING BEST MANAGEMENT PRACTICES TO IMPROVE WATER TEMPERATURE, REDUCE NUTRIENTS AND STREAM SEDIMENT AS WELL AS CONSERVE WATER FOR IN STREAM USES. THEY WILL ALSO HOST A WATER QUALITY WORKSHOP.SUBRECIPIENT:THE NINE SUBAWARDS FUNDED UNDER THIS GRANT WILL FUND ON-THE-GROUND PROJECTS THAT ARE DESIGNED TO REDUCE NONPOINT SOURCE POLLUTION THROUGH IMPLEMENTATION OF AGRICULTURAL BEST MANAGEMENT PRACTICES, STREAM STABILIZATION AND RESTORATION PROJECTS. OUTCOMES:THE ANTICIPATED DELIVERABLES ARE AN ANNUAL REPORT THAT DESCRIBES THE WORK THAT HAS OCCURRED UNDER THE GRANT, DATA INPUT TO THE NATIONAL NONPOINT SOURCE DATABASE AND A WATER QUALITY WORKSHOP. THE EXPECTED ENVIRONMENTAL OUTCOMES INCLUDE REDUCTIONS IN SEDIMENT, NITROGEN AND PHOSPHOROUS FROM NINE SUBAWARDS TO LOCAL ENTITIES. THE INTENDED BENEFICIARY IS CLEANER WATER AND IMPROVED HABITAT FOR AQUATIC SPECIES ACROSS THE STATE OF IDAHO AND ALL STATE RESIDENTS AND OCCUPANTS WHO BENEFIT FROM CLEANER WATER AND HEALTHIER STREAMS.

DIRECT BENEFICIARIES OF THIS PROGRAM INCLUDE ALL STATE RESIDENTS AND OCCUPANTS, BOTH PERMANENT AND TEMPORARY.

SUBRECIPIENT:THE 12 SUBAWARDS FUNDED UNDER THIS GRANT WILL FUND ON-THE-GROUND PROJECTS THAT ARE DESIGNED TO REDUCE NONPOINT SOURCE POLLUTION THROUGH IMPLEMENTATION OF AGRICULTURAL BMPS AND STEAM STABILIZATION AND RESTORATION PROJECTS.OUTCOMES:THE ANTICIPATED DELIVERABLES ARE AN ANNUAL REPORT THAT DESCRIBES THE WORK THAT HAS OCCURRED UNDER THE GRANT, DATA INPUT TO THE NATIONAL NONPOINT SOURCE DATABASE AND A WATER QUALITY WORKSHOP.  THE EXPECTED ENVIRONMENTAL OUTCOMES INCLUDE REDUCTIONS IN SEDIMENT, NITROGEN AND PHOSPHOROUS FROM TWELVE SUBAWARDS TO LOCAL ENTITIES.  THE INTENDED BENEFICIARY IS CLEANER WATER AND IMPROVED HABITAT FOR AQUATIC SPECIES ACROSS THE STATE OF IDAHO AND ALL STATE RESIDENTS AND OCCUPANTS WHO BENEFIT FROM CLEANER WATER AND HEALTHIER STREAMS.

THIS AGREEMENT PROVIDES SUPPORT TO THE STATE OF IDAHO TO IMPLEMENT ITS NONPOINT SOURCE MANAGEMENT PROGRAM, FOCUSING ON WATERSHEDS WITH WATER QUALITY IMPAIRMENTS CAUSED BY POLLUTED RUN-OFF FROM NONPOINT SOURCES.  NONPOINT SOURCE IMPLEMENTATION PROJECTS INCLUDE A VARIETY OF STRUCTURAL AND NON-STRUCTURAL BEST MANAGEMENT PRACTICES (BMPS), WATERSHED PLANNING, MONITORING, TECHNOLOGY, DEMONSTRATIONS, AND A VARIETY OF EDUCATION AND OUTREACH PROGRAMS.
